main event: A Congressional investigation into the U.S. Air Force UFO program was initiated in 1960, with planning including a visit from Dr. J. Allen Hynek.
interesting points: The investigation was prompted by growing public interest and pressure from Congress., Mr. Richard Hines from the Congressional Committee visited to gather information on the UFO program., Colonel Mullins communicated the need for preparation for the upcoming visit from legislative members., Meetings and briefings regarding UFO sightings were conducted to evaluate threats and public interest., The Air Force aimed to minimize publicity around UFO investigations while seeking to obtain factual data.
witness description: The documentation does not specify individual witnesses, but mentions congressional staff and Air Force personnel involved in investigations and briefings.
